translations.translation: or to a destitute lying in dust;
and downtrodden destitute person, (so that he would be of)
Or of a homeless needy person!
Or to a Miskin cleaving to dust.
Or to the poor man lying in the dust.
or a needy man in misery;
Or some poor wretch in misery,
or some needy person in distress,
Or a poor man cleaving to the dust.
or a needy man in desolation,
Or to the indigent (down) in the dust.
Or to a Miskin (poor) afflicted with misery.
or to a needy person in distress;
Or a destitute in the dust.
Or a needy person in misery

[90:16] or a needy person in misery (matraba: [literally means] ‘clinging to the dust [turāb]’ because of his poverty; a variant reading has two verbal nouns in place of the two verbs [fakka, ‘he freed’, and at‘ama, ‘he fed’], the first being in a genitive construction, fakku raqabatin, ‘the freeing of a slave’, and the second with nunation, it‘āmun, ‘to give food’, in which case there is an implied iqtihāmu before al-‘aqaba, of which the said reading becomes the explication);
Or some poor wretch in misery) and who has nothing,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { أَوْ مِسْكِيناً ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ } معناه قد لَزِقَ بالترابِ من الفَقرِ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { أَوْ مِسْكِيناً ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ } [البلد: 16] أسكنه الفقر وإغبره في تراب المذلة والصغار
